page.title: 20Hopes for Southam's Future
page.content: Until the end of the Second World War there had been little change in Southam. The popularity of the car changed that and is the cause of many problems today. Large lorries thunder through Southam making the road very dangerous. There has long been talk of a by-pass but so far nothing has happened. After years of campaigning a pelican crossing was installed recently. In 1974, Southam became part of Stratford-on-Avon District Council. Amenities in Stratford, provided for by the rates of Southam are rather far away to enjoy.It is because of this that S.A.S.P.A.(Southam Area Swimming Pool Association) was formed, to raise money towards the cost of building a pool. A Fun Run was held on July 7th to raise money for this long-awaited swimming pool.
